questions.question_text:
A network administrator was notified that laptop users are unable to see a shared folder on the corporate network.
Which of the following would BEST ensure the laptops are configured correctly?

discussion.content:
Hypervisor is the obvious choice, as it is designed to manage multiple virtual environments.
All other answers are incorrect as none of them manage virtual machines.
thanks for this I was a bit confused honestly, I am new to the A+ side of things and am extremely grateful for these discussions.

A hypervisor is specialized software or firmware that allows the creation, management, and provisioning of virtual machines (VMs) on a physical host. It enables the administrator to allocate resources such as CPU, memory, and storage to each VM, as well as to manage the lifecycle of virtual machines.

questions.question_text:
A systems administrator is configuring a server to host several virtual machines. The administrator configures the server and is ready to begin provisioning the virtual machines.
Which of the following features should the administrator utilize to complete the task?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The answer is correct

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a data transfer standard that transfers 16 bits of data at a time to hard disks?

comments.content:
SAS (Option B) and SCSI (Option D) are both types of high-speed data storage interfaces, but they are typically used in enterprise-level storage systems rather than workstations. These interfaces can provide high-speed data transfer rates, but they are typically more expensive and less commonly used in workstations than M.2 SSDs.

A traditional hard disk drive (Option C) is a type of mechanical storage device that uses spinning disks to store data. While HDDs are still commonly used for large-scale data storage, they are significantly slower than SSDs, especially when it comes to accessing frequently used applications and data.

By installing an M.2 SSD, the technician can improve the workstation's response time for frequently used applications and data without removing the current hard drive, which can be used for additional storage capacity.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The best option to improve a workstation's overall response time for frequently used applications and data without removing the current hard drive would be to install an M.2 (Option A) storage device.

M.2 is a type of solid-state drive (SSD) that uses a high-speed interface to connect directly to the motherboard, offering faster data transfer rates than traditional hard disk drives (HDD). This can result in significantly faster application loading times and improved overall system performance compared to an HDD.

Selected Answer: C
I believe it is C (HDD), the key of the question is: "without removing the current hard drive".
You can add a second HDD and configure a RAID 0 in the operating system using disk management (Windows).
A RAID 0 by the operating system will allow you to keep the same hard drive and increase performance.
